definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: They have cooked and compared North and South Korean dishes.
sentences.chinese: 一起做菜，對比朝鮮和韓國菜。

sentences.english: I don't like Korean dishes so much.
sentences.chinese: 我一點都不喜歡韓國菜。

sentences.english: New Orleans is the home of French cuisine in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，紐奧爾良是法國菜的發源地。

sentences.english: B:I reall find Chinese dishes more to my taste.
sentences.chinese: 我的確覺得國國菜更合我的口味。

sentences.english: Yes, I like French food very much.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我非常喜歡法國菜。

sentences.english: Please challenge Korean food by all means at home at this chance.
sentences.chinese: 請無論如何這個機會，在家庭韓國菜試着挑戰。

sentences.english: I pledge allegiance to our national dish, chicken tikka masala.
sentences.chinese: 我宣誓忠於我們的國菜咖喱雞塊。

sentences.english: Lemon grass! They are key ingredient for my Thai food.
sentences.chinese: 這是檸檬草，它們是泰國菜的關鍵食材。

sentences.english: I love Thai and Japanese foods.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡泰國菜和日本料理。

sentences.english: Thai food, or pizza, or whatever you want.
sentences.chinese: 泰國菜，或者比薩餅，隨你喜歡。
好吧，那泰國菜聽起來如何？

sentences.english: Only in person can enjoy the unique experience that the Thai Suanla flavor.
sentences.chinese: 只有親自品嚐才能體會到泰國菜那種獨特的酸辣味。

sentences.english: Have you ever eaten Thai food?

sentences.chinese: 他們端出上好的法國菜。

sentences.english: In addition, Lemon and Lemon citronella (grass - Thai) is common ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 也是泰國菜常用的配料。
